article:
BTS

BTS, also known as the Bangtan Boys, is a South Korean boy band formed by Big Hit Entertainment in 2013. The group consists of seven members: RM, Jin, Suga, J-Hope, Jimin, V, and Jungkook. BTS is one of the most successful and influential K-pop groups of all time, known for their energetic live performances, meaningful lyrics, and blend of genres such as pop, rock, and hip-hop.

#Name

The name "BTS" stands for the Korean phrase "" (Bangtan Sonyeondan), which translates to "Bulletproof Boy Scouts." The name represents the group's desire to protect their fans from the harsh realities of the world and to be a source of strength and inspiration for them.

#History

##2010–2014: Formation and early years

BTS was formed by Big Hit Entertainment in 2010, with RM as the first member to join the group. The other members were recruited through auditions and joined the group over the next few years. The group trained for three years before debuting on June 13, 2013, with the single "No More Dream" from their debut album "2 Cool 4 Skool."

##2014–2017

###Skool Luv Affair and first concert tour

In 2014, BTS released their second EP "Skool Luv Affair," which marked a turning point in their career. The album's lead single "Boy in Luv" became a hit, and the group embarked on their first concert tour, "2014 BTS Live Trilogy Episode II: The Red Bullet," which took them to several cities in Asia.

###Mainstream breakthrough and commercial success

In 2015, BTS released their third EP "The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 1," which debuted at number one on the Gaon Album Chart. The album's lead single "I Need U" became the group's first top 10 hit on the Gaon Digital Chart. The group's subsequent releases, including "The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 2" and "The Most Beautiful Moment in Life: Young Forever," solidified their position as a leading K-pop group.

###You Never Walk Alone and Love Yourself: Her

In 2017, BTS released their second studio album "Wings," which became the best-selling album in Korea in 2016. The album's lead single "Spring Day" became a hit, and the group embarked on their second world tour, "2017 BTS Live Trilogy Episode III: The Wings Tour." Later that year, the group released a repackage album "You Never Walk Alone," which included the hit single "Not Today." The group's EP "Love Yourself: Her" was released in September 2017, which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart.

##2018–2020

###Love Yourself album series

In 2018, BTS released their third studio album "Love Yourself: Tear," which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album's lead single "Fake Love" became a hit, and the group embarked on their third world tour, "BTS World Tour: Love Yourself." The group's subsequent releases, including "Love Yourself: Answer" and "Map of the Soul: Persona," solidified their position as a global K-pop phenomenon.

###Map of the Soul: Persona, stadium world tour and BTS World

In 2019, BTS released their sixth EP "Map of the Soul: Persona," which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album's lead single "Boy with Luv" featuring Halsey became a hit, and the group embarked on their fourth world tour, "BTS World Tour: Love Yourself: Speak Yourself," which took them to several stadiums around the world. The group also released a mobile game "BTS World" in June 2019.

###Map of the Soul: 7, "Dynamite" and Be

In 2020, BTS released their fourth studio album "Map of the Soul: 7," which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album's lead single "On" became a hit, and the group released a summer single "Dynamite," which became their first number one hit on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The group's EP "Be" was released in November 2020, which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart.

##2021–present

###"Butter", "Permission to Dance" and Proof

In 2021, BTS released a single "Butter," which became a hit and broke several records on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The group also released a single "Permission to Dance," which became a hit and debuted at number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The group's anthology album "Proof" was released in June 2022, which debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart.

###Military service and contract renewal

In 2022, BTS announced that they would be taking a hiatus to focus on their solo activities and military service. The group's members are expected to serve in the military over the next few years, with some members already starting their service. The group's contract with Big Hit Entertainment was renewed in 2021, and they are expected to continue their activities as a group after their military service.

#Artistry

##Influences

BTS's music is influenced by a wide range of genres, including pop, rock, hip-hop, and R&B. The group's members have cited artists such as Kendrick Lamar, The Beatles, and Queen as their inspirations.

##Musical style

BTS's music style is a blend of genres, with a focus on energetic and addictive melodies. The group's songs often feature complex lyrics and meaningful themes, with a focus on self-empowerment and social commentary.

##Lyrical themes

BTS's lyrics often focus on themes such as love, friendship, and self-empowerment. The group's songs also often address social issues such as mental health, bullying, and inequality.

#Impact

##Diplomacy

BTS has been recognized for their cultural diplomacy efforts, with the group being appointed as the special envoys for Korean culture by the Korean government. The group has also been recognized for their efforts to promote Korean language and culture around the world.

##Fandom

BTS's fanbase, known as the ARMY, is one of the largest and most dedicated fanbases in the world. The ARMY has been recognized for their charity efforts, with fans raising millions of dollars for various causes around the world.

#Other ventures

##Endorsements

BTS has endorsement deals with several major brands, including Coca-Cola, Hyundai, and Samsung. The group has also collaborated with several fashion brands, including Dior and Louis Vuitton.

##Philanthropy

BTS is known for their philanthropic efforts, with the group donating to several charities around the world. The group has also been recognized for their efforts to promote education and social welfare.

#Accolades

BTS has won numerous awards for their music, including several Melon Music Awards, Mnet Asian Music Awards, and Billboard Music Awards. The group has also been recognized for their cultural and diplomatic efforts, with several awards from the Korean government and international organizations.

#Members

article:
2022 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament

The 2022 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament was the 40th edition of the NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Championship, played from March 16 to April 3, 2022. The tournament featured 68 teams and was the first to include a play-in round, known as the First Four. The championship game was played at the Target Center in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

# Tournament procedure

The tournament was a single-elimination tournament with 68 teams participating. The teams were divided into four regions: Greensboro, Wichita, Spokane, and Bridgeport. Each region consisted of 16 teams, with the top four teams in each region receiving a bye to the second round. The teams were seeded 1-16 in each region, with the top seed playing the 16th seed, the 2nd seed playing the 15th seed, and so on.

# 2022 NCAA tournament schedule and venues

The tournament schedule was as follows:

* March 16-17: First Four
* March 18-19: First round
* March 20-21: Second round
* March 25-26: Regional semifinals
* March 27-28: Regional finals
* April 1: National semifinals
* April 3: National championship

The tournament was played at the following venues:

* First Four: University of Dayton Arena, Dayton, Ohio
* Greensboro regional: Greensboro Coliseum, Greensboro, North Carolina
* Wichita regional: Intrust Bank Arena, Wichita, Kansas
* Spokane regional: Spokane Arena, Spokane, Washington
* Bridgeport regional: Webster Bank Arena, Bridgeport, Connecticut
* Final Four: Target Center, Minneapolis, Minnesota

## Automatic qualifiers

A total of 32 teams automatically qualified for the tournament by winning their conference tournament championships. The remaining 36 teams were selected by the NCAA Selection Committee.

article:
Wednesday is an American supernatural comedy horror television series based on the character Wednesday Addams from The Addams Family. The series premiered on Netflix in November 2022 and was created by Alfred Gough and Miles Millar.

#Premise
The series follows Wednesday Addams as she is sent to Nevermore Academy, a boarding school for outcasts, after being expelled from her previous school for a horrific incident involving the school's swimming team. As Wednesday navigates her new surroundings, she becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a series of murders and supernatural events that have been occurring in the town. Along the way, she must confront her own dark past and the secrets that have been hidden from her.

#Cast and characters

##Main
The main cast of Wednesday includes:

* Jenna Ortega as Wednesday Addams, a brilliant and eccentric student who is sent to Nevermore Academy after being expelled from her previous school.
* Luis Guzmán as Gomez Addams, Wednesday's father and the patriarch of the Addams Family.
* Gwendoline Christie as Principal Larissa Weems, the principal of Nevermore Academy who has a complicated past with the Addams Family.
* Riki Lindhome as Valerie Kinbott, a botany teacher at Nevermore Academy who becomes an ally to Wednesday.
* Jamie McShane as Donovan Galpin, the sheriff of the local town who is investigating the series of murders.
* Hunter Doohan as Tyler Galpin, the sheriff's son who becomes embroiled in the mystery.
* Percy Hynes White as Xavier Thorpe, a student at Nevermore Academy who becomes a rival to Wednesday.
* Emma Myers as Enid Sinclair, a student at Nevermore Academy who becomes friends with Wednesday.
* Joy Sunday as Bianca Barclay, a popular student at Nevermore Academy who is initially hostile towards Wednesday.

##Recurring
The recurring cast of Wednesday includes:

* Thora Birch as Tamara Novak, a teacher at Nevermore Academy who has a mysterious past.
* Georgie Farmer as Ajax Petropolus, a student at Nevermore Academy who becomes an ally to Wednesday.
* Naomi J. Ogawa as Yoko Tanaka, a student at Nevermore Academy who is initially hostile towards Wednesday.

2023 World Lacrosse Championship

The 2023 World Lacrosse Championship was the 14th edition of the international men's lacrosse tournament, organized by World Lacrosse (WL). The championship was held from June 21 to July 1, 2023, in San Diego, California, United States.

# Hosting

The 2023 World Lacrosse Championship was awarded to San Diego, California, United States in 2018. The championship was hosted by US Lacrosse, with support from the San Diego Sports Commission and the City of San Diego. The tournament featured 30 national teams competing in 86 games across three venues: the Snapdragon Stadium, the Torero Stadium, and the Canyonview Aquatic Center.

# Participating nations

A record 30 national teams participated in the 2023 World Lacrosse Championship, including five teams making their championship debut: Austria, China, Colombia, Singapore, and Thailand. The teams were divided into six pools of five teams each for the pool play stage.

## Schedule

The championship schedule consisted of six days of pool play, followed by five days of playoff games. The top two teams from each pool advanced to the championship playoff bracket, while the remaining teams competed in various placement brackets.

# Pool play

The pool play stage took place from June 21 to June 26, 2023. Each team played four games against the other teams in their pool.

## Pool A

Pool A consisted of the United States, Canada, Australia, England, and Austria. The United States and Canada dominated the pool, with the Americans winning all four games and the Canadians winning three.

## Pool B

Pool B featured the Iroquois Nationals, Japan, Germany, Scotland, and Singapore. The Iroquois Nationals won all four games, while Japan won three.

## Pool C

Pool C consisted of the Czech Republic, Israel, Italy, China, and Colombia. The Czech Republic won three games, with Israel and Italy winning two each.

## Pool D

Pool D featured Wales, Hong Kong, Switzerland, Poland, and Thailand. Wales won three games, with Hong Kong winning two.

## Pool E

Pool E consisted of the Netherlands, Sweden, New Zealand, France, and Spain. The Netherlands won three games, with Sweden and New Zealand winning two each.

## Pool F

Pool F featured Ireland, Latvia, Russia, Greece, and Turkey. Ireland won three games, with Latvia winning two.

# Playoff Stage

The playoff stage took place from June 27 to July 1, 2023.

## 2nd Place Table

The top two teams from each pool advanced to the championship playoff bracket, while the remaining teams competed in various placement brackets. The 2nd place table determined the seeding for the championship playoff bracket.

## Championship Playoff Bracket

The championship playoff bracket featured the top 12 teams, with the top four teams receiving a bye to the quarterfinals. The United States, Canada, the Iroquois Nationals, and Australia advanced to the semifinals, with the Americans and Canadians meeting in the championship game.

## 5th to 8th Place Bracket

The 5th to 8th place bracket featured the teams that lost in the quarterfinals of the championship playoff bracket. Japan won the bracket, defeating England in the final.

## 9th to 14th Place Bracket

The 9th to 14th place bracket featured the teams that lost in the round of 16 of the championship playoff bracket. Germany won the bracket, defeating Scotland in the final.

## 15th to 18th Placement Games

The 15th to 18th placement games featured the teams that lost in the pool play stage. Italy won the 15th place game, defeating China.

## 19th to 22nd Place Bracket

The 19th to 22nd place bracket featured the teams that finished last in their pools. Colombia won the bracket, defeating Singapore in the final.

## 23rd to 26th Placement Games

The 23rd to 26th placement games featured the teams that lost in the 19th to 22nd place bracket. Thailand won the 23rd place game, defeating Austria.

## 27th to 30th Place Bracket

The 27th to 30th place bracket featured the teams that finished last in their pools and lost in the 23rd to 26th placement games. Turkey won the bracket, defeating Greece in the final.

article:
Hurricane Nicole (2022)

Hurricane Nicole was a powerful and destructive tropical cyclone that caused widespread damage and disruption across the Caribbean and the southeastern United States in November 2022. The storm formed in the Atlantic Ocean on November 7, 2022, and rapidly intensified into a hurricane before making landfall in the Bahamas and later in Florida, USA. Nicole's impact was felt across several countries, including the Lesser Antilles, Greater Antilles, Bahamas, and the United States, with the storm causing significant damage to infrastructure, homes, and crops.

#Meteorological history

Hurricane Nicole formed on November 7, 2022, from a tropical wave that had been moving westward across the Atlantic Ocean for several days. The wave had been monitored by the National Hurricane Center (NHC) since November 5, and by the morning of November 7, it had developed sufficient organization to be classified as a tropical depression. The depression rapidly strengthened into a tropical storm, and by the evening of November 7, it had become Hurricane Nicole, with maximum sustained winds of 75 mph (120 km/h).

Over the next 24 hours, Nicole rapidly intensified, with its winds increasing to 105 mph (165 km/h) by the morning of November 8. The storm's central pressure also dropped significantly, reaching a minimum of 965 mbar (28.50 inHg) on November 9. Nicole's rapid intensification was fueled by warm ocean waters and low wind shear, which allowed the storm to develop a strong circulation and a well-defined eye.

#Preparations

##Bahamas

As Nicole approached the Bahamas, the government issued a hurricane warning for the entire country, with residents advised to seek shelter and prepare for the worst. The Royal Bahamas Defence Force (RBDF) was deployed to assist with evacuations and relief efforts, and the Nassau Airport was closed until further notice.

##United States

###Florida

In Florida, Governor Ron DeSantis declared a state of emergency ahead of Nicole's landfall, with residents advised to prepare for strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surge. The Florida National Guard was deployed to assist with evacuations and relief efforts, and several counties issued mandatory evacuation orders for low-lying areas.

###Neighboring states

In neighboring states, including Georgia and South Carolina, residents were advised to prepare for heavy rainfall and strong winds, with flash flooding and power outages possible. The governors of both states declared states of emergency, with emergency management officials closely monitoring the storm's progress.

#Impact

##Lesser Antilles

Nicole's outer rain bands brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to the Lesser Antilles, with several islands experiencing power outages and flooding. The worst-affected islands were Martinique and St. Lucia, where several homes were damaged and roads were impassable.

##Greater Antilles

In the Greater Antilles, Nicole's impact was felt across several countries, including Haiti, the Dominican Republic, and Cuba. In Haiti, several people were killed in flash flooding, with many more displaced. In the Dominican Republic, several homes were damaged, and roads were impassable. In Cuba, the storm caused significant damage to crops, with several thousand homes damaged or destroyed.

##Bahamas

In the Bahamas, Nicole made landfall on November 9, bringing with it strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surge. The worst-affected areas were the Abaco Islands and Grand Bahama, where several homes were destroyed, and roads were impassable. The storm also caused significant damage to the country's infrastructure, including several bridges and roads.

##United States

###Florida

In Florida, Nicole made landfall on November 10, bringing with it strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surge. The worst-affected areas were the eastern coast of the state, including several counties that had been affected by Hurricane Ian just weeks earlier. Several homes were damaged or destroyed, and roads were impassable. The storm also caused significant damage to the state's agriculture, with several thousand acres of crops damaged or destroyed.

###Elsewhere

In other parts of the United States, Nicole's impact was felt across several states, including Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina. In Georgia, several people were killed in flash flooding, with many more displaced. In South Carolina, several homes were damaged, and roads were impassable. In North Carolina, the storm caused significant damage to crops, with several thousand homes damaged or destroyed.

##Canada

In Canada, Nicole's outer rain bands brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to several provinces, including Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, and Prince Edward Island. The worst-affected areas were the provinces of Nova Scotia and New Brunswick, where several homes were damaged, and roads were impassable.

#Aftermath

In the aftermath of Nicole, several countries and states declared states of emergency, with emergency management officials working to assess the damage and provide relief to affected areas. The storm caused significant damage to infrastructure, homes, and crops, with several thousand people displaced. The full extent of the damage is still being assessed, but it is clear that Nicole was a powerful and destructive storm that will have a lasting impact on several countries and states.

article:
Lionel Messi is a professional footballer widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. Born on June 24, 1987, in Rosario, Argentina, Messi has spent his entire career playing for top-tier clubs in Europe, winning numerous accolades and breaking countless records. This article delves into his early life, youth career, club career, international career, player profile, reception, and personal life.

#Early life

Lionel Messi was born in Rosario, Argentina, to Jorge Messi and Celia Cuccittini. He was the third of four children, with two older brothers, Rodrigo and Matías, and a younger sister, María Sol. Messi's father worked as a steel factory worker, while his mother was a part-time cleaner. Messi's paternal grandmother, Celia, was of Italian descent, which later contributed to his dual citizenship. Messi's early life was marked by his love for football, which was encouraged by his family.

#Youth career

##Newell's Old Boys (1995–2000)

At the age of eight, Messi joined the local club Grandoli, where he played alongside his two older brothers. However, it was at Newell's Old Boys that Messi began to develop his skills, joining the club's youth academy in 1995. Messi quickly impressed coaches with his exceptional dribbling skills, speed, and goal-scoring ability. During his time at Newell's Old Boys, Messi formed a close friendship with his teammate, Sergio Agüero, who would later become a fellow professional footballer.

##Barcelona (2000–2004)

In 2000, Messi's family relocated to Barcelona, Spain, after FC Barcelona offered him a contract and agreed to pay for his medical treatment for a growth hormone deficiency. Messi joined the club's youth academy, La Masia, where he trained alongside other young talents, including Xavi, Andrés Iniesta, and Cesc Fàbregas. Messi's skills continued to impress coaches, and he quickly rose through the ranks, playing for the club's various youth teams.

#Club career

##Barcelona (2004–2021)

###2004–2008: Rise to the first team

Messi made his first-team debut for Barcelona on October 16, 2004, at the age of 17, in a match against Espanyol. He quickly established himself as a regular player, scoring his first goal for the club in a match against Albacete on May 1, 2005. During the 2005–06 season, Messi scored six goals in 17 appearances, helping Barcelona win the La Liga title.

###2008–2012: Success under Pep Guardiola

The 2008–09 season saw the arrival of Pep Guardiola as Barcelona's manager, which marked a turning point in Messi's career. Guardiola's tactics and trust in Messi allowed him to flourish, and he scored 38 goals in 51 appearances, helping Barcelona win the treble. Messi's success continued under Guardiola, and he won numerous accolades, including four Ballon d'Or awards.

###2012–2014: Record-breaking year and Messidependencia

The 2012–13 season saw Messi break numerous records, including the most goals scored in a calendar year (91) and the most consecutive games scored in (21). However, this period also saw the rise of "Messidependencia," a term coined to describe Barcelona's reliance on Messi. Despite this, Messi continued to excel, and Barcelona won the La Liga title.

###2014–2017: Arrival of Luis Enrique and birth of MSN

The 2014–15 season saw the arrival of Luis Enrique as Barcelona's manager, which marked a new era for the club. Enrique's tactics led to the formation of the MSN attacking trio, consisting of Messi, Luis Suárez, and Neymar. The trio's success was unprecedented, and they scored a combined 122 goals in the 2015–16 season, helping Barcelona win the treble.

###2017–2021: Final years at Barcelona

Messi's final years at Barcelona were marked by controversy and decline. The 2019–20 season saw the departure of Neymar, and the 2020–21 season saw the departure of Luis Suárez. Despite this, Messi continued to excel, and Barcelona won the Copa del Rey in 2021. However, the club's financial struggles and Messi's desire for a new challenge led to his departure in August 2021.

##Paris Saint-Germain (2021–2023)

On August 10, 2021, Messi joined Paris Saint-Germain on a free transfer. Messi's move to PSG marked a new era for the club, and he quickly formed a partnership with Kylian Mbappé and Neymar. Despite struggling to adapt to the French league, Messi scored 11 goals in 34 appearances, helping PSG win the Ligue 1 title.

##Inter Miami (2023–present)

On July 16, 2023, Messi joined Inter Miami on a free transfer. Messi's move to Inter Miami marked a new challenge for the club, and he quickly became a fan favorite. Despite being in his mid-30s, Messi continues to excel, and his move to Inter Miami has raised the profile of Major League Soccer.

#International career

Messi made his international debut for Argentina on August 17, 2005, in a friendly match against Hungary. He quickly established himself as a regular player, scoring his first goal for Argentina in a match against Croatia on March 1, 2006. Messi's success with Argentina has been marked by controversy and heartbreak, including four Copa América final defeats and a World Cup final defeat to Germany in 2014. However, Messi's dedication to the national team has never wavered, and he continues to be a key player for Argentina.

#Player profile

##Style of play

Messi's playing style is characterized by his exceptional dribbling skills, speed, and goal-scoring ability. He is known for his ability to beat defenders with his quick feet and agility, and his vision and passing range make him a creative force on the pitch.

##Tactical positioning

Messi's tactical positioning has varied throughout his career. He began his career as a left-winger, but he has also played as a right-winger, attacking midfielder, and even as a false 9. Messi's ability to adapt to different positions has made him a versatile player, and his intelligence and vision have allowed him to excel in various roles.

#Reception

##Comparisons with Cristiano Ronaldo

Messi's career has been marked by comparisons with Cristiano Ronaldo, who has been his rival for over a decade. The two players have consistently pushed each other to new heights, and their rivalry has been a defining feature of modern football.

##Comparisons with Diego Maradona

Messi's success has also led to comparisons with Diego Maradona, who is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. Maradona's impact on Argentine football has been immense, and Messi has often been compared to him due to their similar playing styles and achievements.

#In popular culture

##Popularity

Messi's popularity extends beyond the football pitch. He is one of the most marketable athletes in the world, and his endorsement deals and sponsorships have made him a global brand.

##Wealth and sponsorships

Messi's wealth is estimated to be over $1 billion, making him one of the richest athletes in the world. His sponsorships and endorsement deals have contributed significantly to his wealth, and he has partnered with numerous brands, including Adidas, Pepsi, and EA Sports.

##Philanthropy

Messi is also known for his philanthropic efforts. He has supported numerous charitable causes, including the Leo Messi Foundation, which he founded in 2007. The foundation focuses on education, health, and sports development, and has made a significant impact in Argentina and around the world.

##Public art

Messi's image has been immortalized in public art, including statues and murals. His iconic status has inspired countless artists, and his image has become a symbol of excellence and achievement.

##Media

Messi's media presence is immense, and he has been featured in numerous documentaries, films, and television shows. His life and career have been the subject of numerous books, and he has been interviewed by numerous media outlets around the world.

##Business ventures

Messi has also invested in numerous business ventures, including a hotel chain, a clothing line, and a sports equipment company. His business acumen has made him a successful entrepreneur, and his brand continues to grow and evolve.

#Personal life

##Family and relationships

Messi's personal life is marked by his close relationships with his family and friends. He is married to Antonela Roccuzzo, and they have three children together. Messi's family has been a source of support and inspiration throughout his career.

##Tax fraud

In 2013, Messi was accused of tax fraud by the Spanish government. He was found guilty and sentenced to 21 months in prison, but he was able to avoid serving time due to a suspended sentence.

article:
Nathan Chen

Nathan Chen is a Chinese-American figure skater who has been a dominant force in the men's singles event since his senior international debut in 2016. He is a three-time World champion, a two-time Grand Prix Final champion, and the 2022 Olympic champion. Chen is known for his exceptional technical skill, artistic expression, and consistency, which have earned him widespread recognition and acclaim within the figure skating community.

#Early life and family

Nathan Chen was born on May 5, 1999, in Salt Lake City, Utah, to Chinese immigrant parents. His parents, Zhidong Chen and Mei Wang, are both engineers who moved to the United States for work. Chen has two older sisters, Alice and Janice, who also figure skated competitively. He began skating at the age of three, following in the footsteps of his sisters, and quickly fell in love with the sport.

#Competitive skating career

##Early career

Chen began competing in the juvenile and intermediate levels, winning several regional and national titles. In 2009, he moved to California to train with renowned coach, Frank Carroll, who had previously coached Olympic champions Evan Lysacek and Gracie Gold. Under Carroll's guidance, Chen rapidly improved his skills, winning the 2010 US Junior Championships and the 2011 US National Championships in the junior men's event.

##Junior career

Chen made his junior international debut in 2012, competing at the World Junior Championships, where he finished 5th. Over the next two seasons, he won several junior Grand Prix titles and placed 2nd at the 2014 World Junior Championships. Chen's success at the junior level earned him a spot on the US team for the 2014-2015 season, where he competed in the senior Grand Prix series for the first time.

##Senior career

###2016–2017 season: Senior international debut, Four Continents title and first senior national title

Chen made his senior international debut at the 2016 US International Figure Skating Classic, where he won the gold medal. He then went on to compete at the 2016 Cup of China, where he placed 2nd behind Jin Boyang. Chen's breakthrough season continued with a win at the 2017 US National Championships, where he edged out Adam Rippon for the gold medal. At the 2017 Four Continents Championships, Chen won his first senior international title, defeating Yuzuru Hanyu and Jin Boyang in the process.

###2017–2018 season: Pyeongchang Olympics and first World title

Chen's 2017-2018 season was marked by significant milestones. He won his first Grand Prix title at the 2017 Rostelecom Cup and went on to win the 2018 US National Championships, defending his title from the previous year. Chen's Olympic debut at the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics was marred by a disappointing short program, where he placed 17th. However, he rallied in the free skate, finishing 5th overall. At the 2018 World Championships, Chen won his first World title, defeating Hanyu and Mikhail Kolyada in the process.

###2018–2019 season: Second consecutive World title

Chen's 2018-2019 season was marked by continued success. He won his second consecutive Grand Prix title at the 2018 Internationaux de France and went on to win the 2019 US National Championships, defending his title for the third consecutive year. At the 2019 World Championships, Chen won his second consecutive World title, defeating Hanyu and Matteo Rizzo in the process.

###2019–2020 season: Third consecutive Grand Prix Final title

Chen's 2019-2020 season was marked by significant milestones. He won his third consecutive Grand Prix title at the 2019 NHK Trophy and went on to win the 2020 US National Championships, defending his title for the fourth consecutive year. At the 2020 World Championships, Chen was forced to withdraw due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

###2020–2021 season: Third consecutive World title

Chen's 2020-2021 season was marked by continued success. He won his third consecutive World title at the 2021 World Championships, defeating Yuma Kagiyama and Shoma Uno in the process.

###2021–2022 season: Olympic gold medal

Chen's 2021-2022 season was marked by significant milestones. He won his first Olympic gold medal at the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics, defeating Hanyu and Kagiyama in the process.

###2022–23, 2023-24, and 2024–25 seasons: Hiatus

Chen has announced that he will take a hiatus from competitive figure skating for the 2022-2023, 2023-2024, and 2024-2025 seasons. During this time, he plans to focus on his education and personal life.

#Show-skating career

Chen has also had a successful show-skating career, performing in numerous ice shows and exhibitions around the world. He has worked with renowned choreographers, including Benoit Richaud and Shae-Lynn Bourne, and has performed to a wide range of music, from classical to pop.

##Coaching

Chen has been coached by Frank Carroll for the majority of his career. However, in 2020, he announced that he would be moving to Toronto to train with renowned coach, Rafael Arutyunyan.

#Skating technique and style

Chen is known for his exceptional technical skill, which includes a wide range of jumps, including the quadruple Lutz and the quadruple flip. He is also known for his artistic expression, which is characterized by his musicality, flexibility, and emotional depth.

#Public life

##Sponsorships, endorsements and partnerships

Chen has partnered with numerous sponsors and brands, including Red Bull, Bridgestone, and Toyota. He has also worked with several charitable organizations, including the Boys and Girls Clubs of America and the Make-A-Wish Foundation.

##Ambassadorships

Chen has served as an ambassador for several organizations, including the US Figure Skating Association and the International Olympic Committee.

##Books and magazines

Chen has been featured in numerous books and magazines, including Time Magazine, Sports Illustrated, and ESPN The Magazine.

##Film and television

Chen has made appearances on several TV shows, including The Ellen DeGeneres Show and Good Morning America. He has also been featured in several documentaries, including the PBS documentary, "The Figure Skaters".

##Philanthropic work and supported causes

Chen has supported several charitable causes, including the Boys and Girls Clubs of America, the Make-A-Wish Foundation, and the US Figure Skating Association's memorial fund for Karen Chen.

#Awards and recognition

Chen has received numerous awards and recognition for his achievements, including the 2018 US Figure Skating Association's Athlete of the Year award and the 2020 Sports Illustrated Sportsperson of the Year award.

#Personal life and education

Chen is currently enrolled at Yale University, where he is studying statistics and data science. He has stated that he plans to pursue a career in data science after his competitive skating career.

#Records and achievements

Chen has set numerous records and achieved several milestones throughout his career, including becoming the first American man to win three consecutive World titles and the first American man to win an Olympic gold medal in figure skating since Evan Lysacek in 2010.

#Programs

##Competition and exhibition programs

Chen has skated to a wide range of music throughout his career, including classical, pop, and rock. Some of his most notable programs include his 2018-2019 free skate to "Land of All" and his 2020-2021 short program to "Flamenco".

##Programs after the 2022 Winter Olympics

Chen has not announced any new programs since the 2022 Winter Olympics. However, he has stated that he plans to continue skating and performing in ice shows and exhibitions.

article:
Founding Fathers of the United States

The Founding Fathers of the United States were a group of visionary individuals who played a crucial role in the formation and shaping of the country. They were the key figures in the American Revolution and the drafting of the United States Constitution. The term "Founding Fathers" was first used in the early 20th century to describe the individuals who signed the Declaration of Independence in 1776. However, the term has since been expanded to include other individuals who made significant contributions to the country's early development.

# Historical founders

The historical founders of the United States were a diverse group of individuals who came from different backgrounds and had different motivations for seeking independence from Great Britain. Some, like George Washington and Thomas Jefferson, were wealthy landowners who wanted to protect their economic interests. Others, like Samuel Adams and Patrick Henry, were passionate patriots who believed in the cause of American independence.

# Origin of phrase

The term "Founding Fathers" was first used by Warren G. Harding in a 1916 speech. However, it gained popularity in the 1920s and 1930s as a way to describe the individuals who signed the Declaration of Independence. The term was also used to describe other individuals who played important roles in the American Revolution and the early years of the United States.

# List of Founding Fathers

## Framers and signers

The following individuals were among the key Founding Fathers who framed and signed the Declaration of Independence:

* George Washington
* John Adams
* Thomas Jefferson
* Benjamin Franklin
* Robert Livingston
* Roger Sherman
* James Madison
* Alexander Hamilton
* John Jay
* Samuel Adams
* Patrick Henry

### Other delegates

Other delegates who played important roles in the Continental Congress and the drafting of the Declaration of Independence include:

* George Mason
* James Wilson
* George Clymer
* William Ellery
* Oliver Wolcott
* William Williams

## Additional Founding Fathers

Other individuals who made significant contributions to the country's early development include:

* George Rogers Clark
* John Paul Jones
* Francis Marion
* Nathanael Greene
* Henry Knox
* John Sullivan

## Women founders

While women did not play a direct role in the drafting of the Declaration of Independence, several women made significant contributions to the American Revolution and the early years of the United States. Some notable women founders include:

* Abigail Adams
* Dolley Madison
* Deborah Sampson
* Molly Pitcher
* Betsy Ross

## Other patriots

Other individuals who played important roles in the American Revolution and the early years of the United States include:

* Paul Revere
* John Hancock
* Samuel Adams
* Patrick Henry
* George Mason

# The colonies unite (1765–1774)

The colonies began to unite in the mid-1760s, as they resisted British taxation policies and sought greater autonomy. The Stamp Act of 1765, the Townshend Acts of 1767, and the Boston Massacre of 1770 all contributed to growing tensions between the colonies and Great Britain.

# Continental Congress (1774–1775)

## First Continental Congress (1774)

The First Continental Congress met in Philadelphia in September 1774, in response to the Intolerable Acts. The Congress issued a statement of grievances and called for a boycott of British goods.

## Second Continental Congress (1775)

The Second Continental Congress met in Philadelphia in May 1775, following the Battles of Lexington and Concord. The Congress drafted the Declaration of Independence and established the Continental Army.

# Declaration of Independence (1776)

The Declaration of Independence was adopted by the Continental Congress on July 4, 1776. The document, written by Thomas Jefferson, declared the colonies' independence from Great Britain and established the principles of American democracy.

# Fighting for independence

The Continental Army, led by George Washington, fought a long and bloody war against the British Army. The turning point of the war came in 1777, when American forces defeated the British at the Battle of Saratoga.

## Treaty of Paris

The Treaty of Paris, signed in 1783, officially ended the American Revolutionary War and recognized American independence.

# Constitutional Convention

## Virginia and New Jersey plans

The Constitutional Convention, held in Philadelphia in 1787, was attended by representatives from 12 states. The Virginia Plan, proposed by James Madison, called for a strong central government. The New Jersey Plan, proposed by William Paterson, called for a weaker central government.

## Connecticut Compromise

The Connecticut Compromise, proposed by Roger Sherman, established the framework for the United States Senate. The compromise called for equal representation from each state, regardless of population.

## State ratification conventions

The Constitution was ratified by the necessary number of states in 1788. The ratification process was contentious, with some states opposing the document's provisions.

## New form of government

The Constitution established a new form of government, based on federalism and the separation of powers. The document established the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of government.

## Bill of Rights

The Bill of Rights, the first 10 amendments to the Constitution, was adopted in 1791. The amendments established individual liberties and protected citizens from government abuse.

# Ascending to the presidency

George Washington, one of the key Founding Fathers, was inaugurated as the first President of the United States in 1789. He set important precedents for the office and established the cabinet system.

# Demographics and other characteristics

## Political experience

Many of the Founding Fathers had prior experience in politics, having served in colonial legislatures or the Continental Congress.

## Education

### American institutions

Some Founding Fathers attended American institutions, such as Harvard College and the College of William & Mary.

### British institutions

Others attended British institutions, such as Oxford University and Cambridge University.

## Ethnicity

The Founding Fathers were predominantly of English, Scottish, and Welsh descent.

## Occupations

Many of the Founding Fathers were lawyers, politicians, or landowners.

# Religion

The Founding Fathers were predominantly Christian, with many belonging to the Episcopal Church or other Protestant denominations.

# Founders on currency and postage

Many of the Founding Fathers have been featured on American currency and postage stamps.

# Political and cultural impact

## Political rhetoric

The Founding Fathers' ideas about liberty, democracy, and individual rights have had a profound impact on American politics.

## Holidays

Several holidays, including Independence Day and Constitution Day, commemorate the Founding Fathers' achievements.

## Media and theater

The Founding Fathers have been featured in numerous films, plays, and television shows.

## Sports

Several sports teams, including the Philadelphia Founders, have been named after the Founding Fathers.

# Religious freedom

The Founding Fathers established the principle of religious freedom, which has been a cornerstone of American democracy.

# Slavery

The Founding Fathers' views on slavery were complex and often contradictory. While some, like Thomas Jefferson, owned slaves, others, like Benjamin Franklin, opposed the institution.

## Reconstruction as a "Second Founding"

The Reconstruction Era, following the Civil War, has been seen as a "Second Founding" of the United States. The era saw the passage of important legislation, including the 13th, 14th, and 15th Amendments.

# Scholarly analysis

## Early historians

Early historians, such as David Ramsay and Mercy Otis Warren, wrote about the Founding Fathers and their achievements.

## Modern historians

Modern historians, such as Gordon Wood and Bernard Bailyn, have reinterpreted the Founding Fathers' ideas and achievements.

## Noted collections

Several notable collections, including the Library of Congress and the National Archives, hold important documents and artifacts related to the Founding Fathers.

article:
Tennis Pro Tours and Tournament Ranking Series

Tennis is one of the most popular individual sports in the world, with a massive global following and a rich history of competition. At the professional level, tennis is governed by several organizations that oversee various tours and tournament series, providing a structure for players to compete and earn ranking points. This article provides an overview of the main professional tours and tournament ranking series in tennis.

# World Championship Tours

The World Championship tours are the top-level professional tennis tours, featuring the best players from around the world competing in a series of tournaments throughout the year. The two main World Championship tours are the ATP Tour for men and the WTA Tour for women.

## Winners

The winners of the World Championship tours are determined by a points-based system, with players earning points based on their performance in each tournament. The player with the most points at the end of the year is crowned the world champion. Some notable winners of the World Championship tours include:

* ATP Tour: Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal
* WTA Tour: Serena Williams, Steffi Graf, Martina Navratilova

# Tournament Ranking Series

The Tournament Ranking Series is a system used to rank players based on their performance in specific tournaments. The series is divided into several categories, including the Grand Slam tournaments, ATP Masters 1000 and WTA Premier Mandatory tournaments, and ATP 500 and WTA Premier 5 tournaments.

## Winners

The winners of the Tournament Ranking Series are determined by a points-based system, with players earning points based on their performance in each tournament. The player with the most points in each category is crowned the winner. Some notable winners of the Tournament Ranking Series include:

* Grand Slam tournaments: Roger Federer, Serena Williams, Rafael Nadal
* ATP Masters 1000: Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer
* WTA Premier Mandatory: Serena Williams, Maria Sharapova, Simona Halep
* ATP 500: Kei Nishikori, Marin Cilic, Grigor Dimitrov
* WTA Premier 5: Petra Kvitová, Angelique Kerber, Karolína Plíšková

# Other Professional Tours

In addition to the World Championship tours and Tournament Ranking Series, there are several other professional tours that provide opportunities for players to compete and earn ranking points. These tours include:

## Women

* ITF Women's Circuit: A series of tournaments for women that provide a pathway for players to transition from the junior circuit to the professional circuit.
* WTA 125K Series: A series of tournaments for women that provide a stepping stone for players to transition from the ITF Women's Circuit to the WTA Tour.

## Men

* ATP Challenger Tour: A series of tournaments for men that provide a pathway for players to transition from the junior circuit to the professional circuit.
* ITF Men's Circuit: A series of tournaments for men that provide a stepping stone for players to transition from the junior circuit to the ATP Tour.

# See also

* Tennis
* ATP Tour
* WTA Tour
* Grand Slam tournaments
* ATP Masters 1000
* WTA Premier Mandatory
* ATP 500
* WTA Premier 5

# Notes

This article provides a general overview of the professional tennis tours and tournament ranking series. For more information on specific tours or tournaments, please refer to the relevant articles.

# References

This article does not include any references or citations.

# Bibliography

This article does not include any bibliography.

# External links

* ATP Tour official website
* WTA Tour official website
* ITF official website
* Grand Slam tournaments official website

The 2023 UK Open was a major darts tournament held at the Butlin's Resort in Minehead, England from 3-5 March 2023. The event was the 21st edition of the UK Open and featured a field of 160 players competing for the title.

#Prize money

The total prize fund for the 2023 UK Open was £800,000, with the winner receiving £170,000. The prize money was distributed as follows:

* Winner: £170,000
* Runner-up: £70,000
* Semi-finals: £35,000
* Quarter-finals: £20,000
* Fifth round: £10,000
* Sixth round: £6,000
* Fourth round: £4,000

The 2023 UK Open was a knockout tournament featuring a field of 160 players. article:
2023 Scottish National Party leadership election

The 2023 Scottish National Party leadership election was a leadership election held to determine the next leader of the Scottish National Party (SNP), following the resignation of Nicola Sturgeon as leader on 15 February 2023. The election was won by Humza Yousaf, who became the first Muslim leader of a major UK party.

Background

Nicola Sturgeon had been the leader of the Scottish National Party since 2014, and had been the First Minister of Scotland since 2014. However, on 15 February 2023, she announced her intention to resign as leader of the party and as First Minister, citing the challenges of the job and the need for fresh leadership. The party's national executive committee (NEC) met to discuss the process for electing a new leader, and it was decided that the election would be held using a one-member-one-vote system.

Issues

### Economics

The Scottish economy was a major issue in the election, with all three candidates proposing different approaches to economic growth and development. Kate Forbes proposed a more cautious approach, arguing that the Scottish Government should focus on supporting existing businesses and industries. Ash Regan proposed a more radical approach, arguing that the Scottish Government should take a more active role in shaping the economy and promoting economic growth. Humza Yousaf proposed a more balanced approach, arguing that the Scottish Government should support both existing businesses and new industries.

### Independence

The issue of Scottish independence was also a major factor in the election, with all three candidates supporting independence but differing on the timing and approach. Kate Forbes argued that the Scottish Government should focus on building support for independence and preparing for a referendum, but not rush into holding one. Ash Regan argued that the Scottish Government should hold a referendum as soon as possible, and be prepared to take a more radical approach to achieving independence. Humza Yousaf argued that the Scottish Government should continue to make the case for independence, but also be prepared to work with other parties and build a broader coalition in support of independence.

### Gender recognition reform

The issue of gender recognition reform was also a contentious issue in the election, with the three candidates differing on the Scottish Government's approach to reforming the Gender Recognition Act. Kate Forbes expressed concerns about the impact of the reforms on women's rights and children's safety, while Ash Regan and Humza Yousaf supported the reforms and argued that they were necessary to promote equality and human rights.

Campaign

### Nomination period

The nomination period for the election opened on 15 February 2023, and closed on 22 February 2023. During this period, candidates had to secure the support of at least 100 party members and submit a nomination fee of £1,000.

### Kate Forbes

Kate Forbes, the Finance Secretary, launched her campaign on 20 February 2023. She argued that she had the experience and skills necessary to lead the party and the country, and proposed a more cautious approach to economic growth and development.

### Ash Regan

Ash Regan, the former Community Safety Minister, launched her campaign on 20 February 2023. She argued that she had the vision and passion necessary to lead the party and the country, and proposed a more radical approach to economic growth and development.

### Humza Yousaf

Humza Yousaf, the Health Secretary, launched his campaign on 20 February 2023. He argued that he had the experience and skills necessary to lead the party and the country, and proposed a more balanced approach to economic growth and development.

### Hustings

A series of hustings events were held around Scotland, where the three candidates debated the issues and answered questions from party members. The hustings were widely covered in the media, and helped to raise the profile of the candidates and the election.

### Row about membership numbers

A row broke out during the campaign about the number of party members, with the party's national executive committee (NEC) refusing to release the exact number of members. The candidates and their supporters accused the NEC of trying to manipulate the election, while the NEC argued that it was necessary to protect the privacy of party members.

Election process

The election was held using a one-member-one-vote system, where every party member had one vote. The votes were counted using a preferential voting system, where voters ranked the candidates in order of preference. The candidate with the fewest first-preference votes was eliminated, and their second-preference votes were redistributed to the remaining candidates. This process continued until one candidate had more than 50% of the votes.

Candidates

### Declared

* Kate Forbes
* Ash Regan
* Humza Yousaf

### Declined

* Angus Robertson, the Constitution Secretary, declined to stand in the election, citing his support for Nicola Sturgeon and his desire to focus on his role as Constitution Secretary.
* Mhairi Black, the MP for Paisley and Renfrewshire South, declined to stand in the election, citing her support for Nicola Sturgeon and her desire to focus on her role as an MP.

Endorsements

### Kate Forbes

* Kate Forbes was endorsed by a number of party members and MSPs, including the MSPs Liam McArthur and Willie Rennie.
* She was also endorsed by the Scottish Daily Mail, which argued that she was the most experienced and capable candidate.

### Ash Regan

* Ash Regan was endorsed by a number of party members and MSPs, including the MSPs Joan McAlpine and Emma Harper.
* She was also endorsed by the Scottish Sun, which argued that she was the most passionate and committed candidate.

### Humza Yousaf

* Humza Yousaf was endorsed by a number of party members and MSPs, including the MSPs Aileen Campbell and Kevin Stewart.
* He was also endorsed by the Scottish Daily Record, which argued that he was the most experienced and capable candidate.

### Declined to endorse

* Nicola Sturgeon declined to endorse any of the candidates, citing her desire to remain neutral and allow party members to make their own decision.

Debates

A number of debates were held during the campaign, where the three candidates debated the issues and answered questions from party members and the media. The debates were widely covered in the media, and helped to raise the profile of the candidates and the election.

Hustings

A series of hustings events were held around Scotland, where the three candidates debated the issues and answered questions from party members. The hustings were widely covered in the media, and helped to raise the profile of the candidates and the election.

Opinion polling

A number of opinion polls were conducted during the campaign, which showed a range of different results.

### SNP membership

* A poll of SNP members conducted by the website Wings Over Scotland found that Humza Yousaf was the most popular candidate, with 34% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 25% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 21% of the vote.
* A poll of SNP members conducted by the website The National found that Kate Forbes was the most popular candidate, with 31% of the vote. Humza Yousaf was second, with 26% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 22% of the vote.

### 2021 SNP voters

* A poll of 2021 SNP voters conducted by the website YouGov found that Humza Yousaf was the most popular candidate, with 27% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 24% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 20% of the vote.
* A poll of 2021 SNP voters conducted by the website Survation found that Kate Forbes was the most popular candidate, with 29% of the vote. Humza Yousaf was second, with 25% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 22% of the vote.

### Scottish public

* A poll of the Scottish public conducted by the website YouGov found that Humza Yousaf was the most popular candidate, with 24% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 20% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 17% of the vote.
* A poll of the Scottish public conducted by the website Survation found that Kate Forbes was the most popular candidate, with 26% of the vote. Humza Yousaf was second, with 23% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 20% of the vote.

Results

The results of the election were announced on 27 March 2023. Humza Yousaf won the election, with 52.1% of the vote. Kate Forbes was second, with 31.5% of the vote, while Ash Regan was third, with 16.4% of the vote.

### Preference votes by candidate

* Humza Yousaf: 52.1%
* Kate Forbes: 31.5%
* Ash Regan: 16.4%

Aftermath

Humza Yousaf was formally appointed as the leader of the Scottish National Party and the First Minister of Scotland on 29 March 2023. He announced his new cabinet on the same day, which included a number of new ministers and a number of ministers who had served under Nicola Sturgeon.

article:
Stabbing of Salman Rushdie

Sir Salman Rushdie, a British-American novelist, was stabbed on August 12, 2022, while preparing to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution in Chautauqua, New York. The attack, which shocked the literary world and sparked widespread condemnation, occurred over 30 years after Ayatollah Khomeini issued a fatwa calling for Rushdie's death in response to the publication of his novel "The Satanic Verses".

Background

Salman Rushdie, a prominent author known for his works of magical realism, had been the subject of a fatwa issued by Ayatollah Khomeini in 1989. The fatwa, which called for Rushdie's death, was in response to the publication of his novel "The Satanic Verses", which some Muslims believed blasphemed against the Prophet Muhammad. The fatwa led to a significant increase in security measures for Rushdie, who was forced to live in hiding for several years. Although the Iranian government officially lifted the fatwa in 1998, many believed that it was still in effect, and Rushdie continued to face threats and intimidation.

Attack

On August 12, 2022, Rushdie was scheduled to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution, a non-profit educational center in Chautauqua, New York. As he took the stage, a man rushed forward and stabbed him multiple times in the neck and torso. The attacker, who was later identified as Hadi Matar, was subdued by audience members and security personnel. Rushdie was airlifted to a nearby hospital, where he underwent emergency surgery.

Injuries and recovery

Rushdie suffered serious injuries in the attack, including a punctured lung and damage to his liver. He underwent emergency surgery and was placed on a ventilator. His condition was initially listed as critical, but he was later upgraded to stable. Rushdie's agent, Andrew Wylie, reported that the author was likely to lose an eye and had suffered nerve damage in his arm. Rushdie was eventually transferred to a rehabilitation center, where he began the long process of recovery.

Criminal investigation and prosecution

## Suspect

Hadi Matar, a 24-year-old man from Fairview, New Jersey, was arrested and charged with attempted murder in the second degree. Matar, who was born in the United States to Lebanese parents, had traveled to Iran in 2018, where he had become radicalized. According to officials, Matar had been inspired by the fatwa against Rushdie and had planned the attack for months. Matar had also been in contact with members of the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps, who had encouraged him to carry out the attack.

Response

## United States

The attack on Rushdie was widely condemned by officials in the United States. President Joe Biden released a statement expressing his shock and outrage at the attack, and calling for the perpetrator to be brought to justice. The FBI launched an investigation into the attack, and the Department of Justice announced that it would be charging Matar with attempted murder.

## Iran

The Iranian government was quick to distance itself from the attack, with a spokesperson for the Foreign Ministry stating that Iran had no connection to the incident. However, many observers noted that the attack was consistent with the long-standing fatwa against Rushdie, and that the Iranian government had done little to retract or condemn the fatwa in the years since its issuance.

## Hezbollah

Hezbollah, a Shia Islamist organization based in Lebanon, released a statement praising the attack on Rushdie. The statement, which was issued by the organization's deputy secretary-general, Naim Qassem, called the attack a "heroic" act and praised Matar for his bravery.

## Other nations

The attack on Rushdie was widely condemned by governments and literary organizations around the world. The British government, in particular, was vocal in its condemnation, with Prime Minister Boris Johnson releasing a statement expressing his shock and outrage at the attack. The French government also condemned the attack, with President Emmanuel Macron calling it a "cowardly" act.

Cultural effect

The attack on Rushdie has had a significant impact on the literary world, with many authors and writers expressing their outrage and solidarity with the victim. The attack has also sparked a wider debate about the role of free speech and the dangers of censorship.

## Memoir

Rushdie has announced plans to write a memoir about the attack and its aftermath. The book, which is expected to be published in 2024, will provide a detailed account of the attack and Rushdie's recovery, as well as his reflections on the wider cultural and literary implications of the incident.

Security at the Chautauqua Institution

The attack on Rushdie has raised questions about the security measures in place at the Chautauqua Institution. The institution has stated that it had taken steps to increase security in the wake of the fatwa against Rushdie, but many have questioned whether these measures were sufficient. The institution has announced plans to review its security protocols in the wake of the attack.

article:
Grant Wahl

Grant Wahl was an American sports journalist and author, best known for his work as a soccer writer for Sports Illustrated and Fox Sports. He was one of the most respected and influential voices in American soccer, known for his in-depth reporting and analysis of the sport.

#Early life and education

Grant Wahl was born on December 29, 1973, in Mission, Kansas. He developed an interest in soccer at an early age and played the sport throughout his childhood. Wahl attended Shawnee Mission East High School in Prairie Village, Kansas, where he was a member of the school's soccer team.

Wahl went on to attend Princeton University, where he studied history and was a member of the university's soccer team. During his time at Princeton, Wahl began to develop his writing skills, serving as the sports editor for the university's student newspaper, The Daily Princetonian.

#Career

After graduating from Princeton in 1996, Wahl began his career in sports journalism as an intern at the Miami Herald. He later moved to Kansas City, where he worked as a sports writer for the Kansas City Star.

In 1996, Wahl joined Sports Illustrated as a fact-checker, eventually becoming a staff writer for the magazine in 2000. During his time at Sports Illustrated, Wahl established himself as one of the leading voices in American soccer, covering numerous World Cups, Olympic Games, and other major international tournaments.

Wahl's reporting and analysis focused on the human side of the sport, exploring the cultural, social, and economic factors that shape the game. He was known for his in-depth profiles of soccer players, coaches, and executives, as well as his investigative reporting on issues such as racism, corruption, and player safety.

In addition to his work at Sports Illustrated, Wahl also served as a commentator and analyst for Fox Sports, providing coverage of the World Cup, the UEFA Champions League, and other major soccer tournaments.

#Personal life

Wahl was married to Celine Gounder, a physician and epidemiologist, in 2001. The couple had three children together and resided in New York City.

Wahl was an avid fan of the Kansas City Chiefs and the Kansas City Royals, and he often incorporated his love of sports into his reporting and writing.

#Death

Grant Wahl died on December 9, 2022, while covering the 2022 World Cup in Doha, Qatar. He was 49 years old at the time of his death. Wahl had been experiencing chest pains and other health issues in the days leading up to his death, but the exact cause of his passing has not been publicly disclosed.

#Awards and recognition

Throughout his career, Wahl received numerous awards and accolades for his reporting and writing. He was a three-time winner of the National Sportscasters and Sportswriters Association's Sportswriter of the Year award, and he was also named one of the 50 most influential people in American sports by Sports Illustrated.

#Books

Wahl was the author of two books on soccer: "The Beckham Experiment" (2009) and "Masters of Modern Soccer" (2018). "The Beckham Experiment" explored the impact of David Beckham's arrival in Major League Soccer, while "Masters of Modern Soccer" examined the tactics and strategies of some of the world's top soccer teams.

Silly Mountain

Silly Mountain is a prominent geological feature located in the heart of a vast and diverse region, known for its unique blend of natural beauty, rich history, and exciting recreational opportunities. The mountain has been a source of fascination for locals and visitors alike, offering breathtaking views, diverse wildlife, and a wide range of outdoor activities.

#Location

Silly Mountain is situated in a scenic valley, surrounded by rolling hills and dense forests. The mountain's summit rises to an elevation of 1,200 meters above sea level, providing a panoramic view of the surrounding landscape. The mountain's location makes it easily accessible by car, with several parking areas and trailheads located at its base.

#Origin of the name

The origin of the name "Silly Mountain" is shrouded in mystery, with several theories attempting to explain its etymology. One theory suggests that the name "Silly" comes from the local dialect, in which "silly" means "happy" or "merry." Another theory proposes that the name is derived from the mountain's unique shape, which resembles a smiling face. Despite the uncertainty surrounding its origin, the name "Silly Mountain" has become an integral part of the region's identity.

#Flora

Silly Mountain is home to a diverse range of flora, including deciduous and coniferous trees, shrubs, and wildflowers. The mountain's forests are dominated by species such as oak, beech, and pine, which provide a habitat for a variety of wildlife. The mountain's slopes are also covered with a variety of shrubs, including heather, gorse, and bilberry. In the spring, the mountain's meadows are ablaze with color, as wildflowers such as bluebells, daffodils, and primroses bloom.

##Fauna

###Birds

#Geology

Silly Mountain is a geological feature of great interest, with a complex and varied geology. The mountain's core is composed of granite, which is surrounded by a ring of volcanic rocks. The mountain's slopes are covered with a layer of sedimentary rocks, including sandstone and shale. The mountain's geology has been shaped by a combination of tectonic activity and erosion, which have created its unique landscape.

##Mining

The most significant mineral deposits include copper, lead, and zinc, which were mined extensively during the 19th and 20th centuries. Although mining activity has declined in recent years, the mountain's mineral deposits remain an important part of its geological heritage.

article:
Royal Rumble (2023)

The Royal Rumble was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by WWE that took place on January 28, 2023, at the Alamodome in San Antonio, Texas. It was the 36th annual Royal Rumble event and featured wrestlers from the Raw and SmackDown brands.

# Production

## Background

The Royal Rumble is an annual event produced by WWE, typically held in late January. It is one of the company's "Big Four" events, along with WrestleMania, SummerSlam, and Survivor Series. The event features the Royal Rumble match, a 30-man over-the-top rope battle royal where the winner earns a world championship match at WrestleMania.

## Storylines

The event featured several matches with storylines that developed in the weeks leading up to the event. The main feud on the Raw brand was between Seth Rollins and Finn Bálor, who were scheduled to face each other in a number one contender match for the United States Championship. On the SmackDown brand, the main feud was between Roman Reigns and Kevin Owens, who were scheduled to face each other for the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship.

# Event

## Preliminary matches

The event began with a fatal 4-way match for the Tag Team Championship, featuring The Usos, The New Day, The Street Profits, and Alpha Academy. The match was won by The Usos, who retained their titles. The next match was a singles match between Liv Morgan and Raquel Rodriguez, which was won by Rodriguez.

## Main event

The main event of the evening was the Men's Royal Rumble match, which featured 30 wrestlers from the Raw and SmackDown brands. The match was won by Cody Rhodes, who last eliminated Gunther to earn a world championship match at WrestleMania. The Women's Royal Rumble match was also held, and was won by Rhea Ripley, who last eliminated Liv Morgan to earn a women's world championship match at WrestleMania.

# Reception

The event received generally positive reviews from fans and critics. The Men's Royal Rumble match was praised for its exciting entrances and eliminations, while the Women's Royal Rumble match was praised for its athleticism and storytelling. The main event matches were also well-received, with many praising the performances of Seth Rollins and Finn Bálor in their number one contender match.

# Aftermath

## Raw

On the following episode of Raw, Cody Rhodes celebrated his Royal Rumble win with a promo, where he announced his intention to challenge Roman Reigns for the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship at WrestleMania. Seth Rollins and Finn Bálor also appeared, where they announced their participation in the Elimination Chamber match for the United States Championship.

## SmackDown

On the following episode of SmackDown, Rhea Ripley celebrated her Royal Rumble win with a promo, where she announced her intention to challenge Charlotte Flair for the SmackDown Women's Championship at WrestleMania. Roman Reigns and Kevin Owens also appeared, where they continued their feud for the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship.

2023 Malaysia Super League

The 2023 Malaysia Super League is the 20th season of the Malaysia Super League, the top-tier professional football league in Malaysia. The season began on 24 February 2023 and is scheduled to conclude on 27 August 2023.

# Teams

A total of 12 teams are competing in the league this season.

## Changes from last season

### Team changes

* Sarawak United and Negeri Sembilan were relegated to the 2023 Malaysia Premier League after finishing 11th and 12th respectively in the 2022 Malaysia Super League.
* Kuching City and Kelantan were promoted from the 2022 Malaysia Premier League after finishing 1st and 2nd respectively.
* Sabah was readmitted to the league after serving a one-year suspension.

## Clubs locations

The following are the locations of the 12 teams competing in the 2023 Malaysia Super League:

* East Coast: Kelantan, Terengganu
* Central Region: Kuala Lumpur City, Petaling Jaya City, Selangor
* Southern Region: Johor Darul Ta'zim, Melaka United
* East Malaysia: Kuching City, Sabah
* Northern Region: Penang
* Borneo: Sabah

# Personnel, kit and sponsoring

## Coaching changes

* Kuala Lumpur City: Bojan Hodak replaced Chad Gould as head coach.
* Penang: Manzoor Azwira Abdul Wahid replaced Tomáš Trucha as head coach.
* Sabah: Ong Kim Swee replaced Pengiran Bala as head coach.

# Foreign players

* A maximum of four foreign players are allowed per team.
* A maximum of two foreign players from the ASEAN region are allowed per team.

## Naturalisation/Heritage players

article:
Super Bowl LVI

Super Bowl LVI was the 56th edition of the Super Bowl, the annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL). The game was played on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, marking the first time the Super Bowl was held in the Los Angeles area since Super Bowl XXVII in 1993.

#Background

##Host selection process

The host selection process for Super Bowl LVI began in 2019, with the NFL inviting interested cities to submit bids. The Los Angeles Rams and Chargers, who had recently relocated to the city, partnered with the Los Angeles Sports & Entertainment Commission to submit a bid. The bid was successful, and on May 23, 2019, the NFL announced that the Los Angeles area would host Super Bowl LVI.

##Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the planning and execution of Super Bowl LVI. The NFL and local authorities implemented various health and safety protocols, including reduced capacity at SoFi Stadium, mask mandates, and enhanced cleaning and disinfection procedures. The pandemic also affected the game's entertainment and broadcasting plans, with some events and activities being modified or canceled.

#Teams

##Los Angeles Rams

The Los Angeles Rams, led by head coach Sean McVay, finished the 2021 NFL season with a 12-5 record, winning the NFC West division title. The Rams entered the playoffs as the fourth seed in the NFC and defeated the Arizona Cardinals in the Wild Card Round, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in the Divisional Round, and the San Francisco 49ers in the NFC Championship Game.

##Cincinnati Bengals

The Cincinnati Bengals, led by head coach Zac Taylor, finished the 2021 NFL season with a 10-7 record, winning the AFC North division title. The Bengals entered the playoffs as the fourth seed in the AFC and defeated the Las Vegas Raiders in the Wild Card Round, the Tennessee Titans in the Divisional Round, and the Kansas City Chiefs in the AFC Championship Game.

##Playoffs

The Rams and Bengals both won their respective conference championships to advance to Super Bowl LVI. The Rams defeated the 49ers 20-17 in the NFC Championship Game, while the Bengals defeated the Chiefs 27-24 in the AFC Championship Game.

##Pre-game notes

The Rams were considered 4.5-point favorites by sportsbooks, with an over/under of 48.5 points. The game was expected to be a close and competitive matchup between two high-powered offenses.

#Entertainment

##Pre-game ceremonies

The pre-game ceremonies for Super Bowl LVI featured a performance by Mickey Guyton, who sang the national anthem. The coin toss was performed by Billie Jean King, a tennis legend and social activist.

##Halftime show

The halftime show for Super Bowl LVI featured a performance by Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige, and Kendrick Lamar. The show was widely praised for its high-energy performance and nostalgic value.

#Broadcasting

##United States

###Television

Super Bowl LVI was broadcast on NBC in the United States, with Al Michaels and Cris Collinsworth providing commentary. The game was also broadcast in Spanish on Telemundo.

####Advertising

The cost of a 30-second commercial during Super Bowl LVI was estimated to be around $6.5 million. Several major brands, including Pepsi, Coca-Cola, and Budweiser, aired high-profile commercials during the game.

###Streaming

Super Bowl LVI was also available to stream on various platforms, including NBCSports.com, the NBC Sports app, and Peacock.

###Radio

The game was broadcast on radio by Westwood One, with Kevin Harlan and Kurt Warner providing commentary.

###Ratings and viewership

Super Bowl LVI drew an average audience of 112.3 million viewers on NBC, making it one of the most-watched television events in U.S. history.

##International

Super Bowl LVI was broadcast in over 180 countries and territories around the world, with several international broadcasters airing the game.

#Game summary

##First half

The Rams received the opening kickoff and drove down the field, with quarterback Matthew Stafford throwing a 79-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Cooper Kupp. The Bengals responded with a field goal, but the Rams scored again on a 1-yard touchdown run by running back Cam Akers. The Bengals scored a touchdown late in the half, but the Rams led 13-10 at halftime.

##Second half

The Rams extended their lead in the third quarter, with Stafford throwing a 75-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. The Bengals responded with a touchdown, but the Rams scored again on a 79-yard touchdown pass from Stafford to Kupp. The Bengals scored a late touchdown, but the Rams held on for a 23-20 victory.

#Final statistics

##Statistical comparison

The Rams outgained the Bengals in total yards, 395-305, and had more first downs, 24-19. The Bengals rushed for more yards, 79-43, but the Rams had more passing yards, 352-226.

##Individual statistics

Matthew Stafford threw for 283 yards and 3 touchdowns, with 2 interceptions. Joe Burrow threw for 263 yards and 1 touchdown, with no interceptions. Cooper Kupp had 8 receptions for 92 yards and 2 touchdowns, while Ja'Marr Chase had 5 receptions for 89 yards.

#Aftermath

2023 NBA Playoffs

The 2023 NBA playoffs was the postseason tournament of the National Basketball Association's 2022-2023 season. The playoffs began on April 15, 2023, and ended with the NBA Finals on June 12, 2023.

# Overview

The 2023 NBA playoffs saw several teams make their postseason debuts, while others continued their playoff droughts.

## Updates to postseason appearances

The Miami Heat made their 14th consecutive playoff appearance, the longest active streak in the NBA. The Denver Nuggets and Memphis Grizzlies both made their fourth consecutive playoff appearances.

## Notable occurrences

### First round

In the first round, the Boston Celtics swept the Atlanta Hawks in four games, while the Phoenix Suns defeated the Los Angeles Clippers in five games.

### Conference semifinals

In the conference semifinals, the Denver Nuggets defeated the Phoenix Suns in five games, while the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Golden State Warriors in seven games.

### Conference finals

In the conference finals, the Denver Nuggets defeated the Los Angeles Lakers in five games, while the Miami Heat defeated the Boston Celtics in five games.

### NBA Finals

The Denver Nuggets won their first NBA championship in franchise history, defeating the Miami Heat in five games.

# Format

The 2023 NBA playoffs followed the standard 16-team, best-of-seven playoff format. The playoffs consisted of four rounds: the first round, conference semifinals, conference finals, and the NBA Finals.

# Playoff qualifying

The top eight teams from each conference qualified for the playoffs.
